title: Project-Based Learning Course for International Cultural Understanding and Expansion of Mathematical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and general understanding of multicultural environments
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing learner agency and self-directed learning environments through Cultural-Historical Activity Theory (CHAT), operating in smartphone-centric limited-technology settings while developing collaborative problem-solving skills via learning communities

learning_goals: Learners can compare mathematical problem-solving approaches across cultures and explain the influence of cultural differences on mathematical methods.
Learners can represent and interpret culture-specific data analysis results as mathematical models through project-based activities.
Learners systematically manage their learning process through peer feedback and self-reflection, improving learning outcomes by over 30%.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
